content.description: One hit wonder. Hard, bouldery start with no rests but great movement.  After a rest ledge, movement eases up with every bolt finishing on alligator plated face to chain anchors.
content.location: Starts behind a large oak tree just right of a broken corner.  This is the right hand route of the 4 routes in this upper left section of the cliff

content.description: Start by looking at the really high first bolt... then boulder up there to clip it.  Starting near Black Ice might help you get established on the rock while heading to the first bolt.  Semi steep pulling on positive holds leads to anchors.
content.location: Starts just to the right of Black Ice.  Look for the high first bolt.  Anchors on top.

content.description: Start by underclinging your way up towards a couple of overlaps.  Crux is probably passing these roofy overlaps.  Follow bolts as they trend to the right and up easier face above.  Rock is pretty good and this is one of the better routes up in this area.
content.location: Starts just right of Vera's Hooop at a couple of underclings on a brown wall. Climbs easier than it looks from the ground.

content.description: Start in grungie but obvious crack system left of bottom four routes.  After a couple placements over not-so-wonderful rock (kitty litter), the rock quality improves and bolt line will be seen.  Follow up over several more potential gear placements and bolts to chain anchors.  Top ropes well due to high anchors.
content.protection: Single c3's on up to about a 3" cam with a set of nuts will work fine.
content.location: Left most route of the bottom - four group.

content.description: Start in two baseball sized black holes.  Maybe go left-ish to some dike like features or stay right on the grainy rounded layaway.  Both methods are sorta funky and will work.  Head up to the roof via a couple funky moves and get the reward of some good holds above the roof.  Eases from here up to the anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts to chains.  Anchor is set high above a rubble covered ledge.  Watch out as not to knock down rocks while doing the last few moves to the anchor.
content.location: Starts 10 feet to the right of the big right facing corner.  Look for the bolts and two black baseball sized holes at the start.  Chains on top.

content.description: Start in a left facing flake and layback up toward a dike then move right via a couple stiff moves.  Continue climbing until right near the top a finger ramp will appear.  Bust a move out right on the slab while using the finger rail.  Getting established on the grainy slab while working the finger rail is probably the crux.
content.location: Right - most route of the Attic.  Starts up the large flake that opens to the left. Mussy Hooks on top.

content.description: Follow a low angle ramp up and left while wandering in and out of a black streak.  Crux is at the 3rd bolt with a black hanger.  A fall here could land you on the ramp below.  The next bolt is in a funky place too, but after this things will return to normal.
content.location: Starts at the end of the wall where the gully pinches down.  Pink and black rock.

content.description: Looks pretty reasonable from the ground.  Climb up into the corner and start doing some contortions as you work up the corner.  Your fingers will probably not fit that well into the disjointed crack so maybe try some stemming, bridging, and funky kickback ninja stuff.  At the top of the corner is your first bolt.  I bet you will really want it.  Continue up the grainy rock above past a few more bolts.
content.protection: Crack will take some small pro up to about 1".  After the initial corner, there are 4 or more bolts.  Anchor on top is chains.
content.location: Big, white, right-facing dihedral with bench-like flat rock at base.

content.description:
A less crowded, mainly sport area with 6 sport routes and two trad/bolted in the 5.10 range. Anchors are either Mussy Hooks or chains and are noted in the various route notes.  All routes are bolted with exception of two which have gear for first half then finish on bolts.  

 L to R temporary guide until routes can be added: [The wall is fairly well grouped into two groups of four routes each; the lower 4 which you approach first then the upper four up the hill.] TBD-1 5.9 :(bolts): Left - most route. TBD-2 5.9+ :(bolts): Slabby start. TBD-3 5.9+ :(bolts): Interesting traversing movement on this one. TBD-4 5.10c :(bolts): Thought - provoking start. -- TBD-5 5.9 :(trad/bolts): Start up obvious crack system to a roof - like feature at around 25-30' on gear. Finishes on bolts. TBD-6 5.10a :(trad/bolts): Head up glaring dihedral just left of the two right-most bolted lines. Has a rock bench at base. TBD-7 5.10a :(bolts): Climbs an interesting blocky crack section to face climbing. Surmount crux headwall feature to ledge then easy run up to anchor. TBD-8 5.9+ :(bolts): Flake/crack start leads up to airy finish on the floating boulders at top. Traverse finger crack up to anchor.

 The area is fairly new so please wear a helmet. All large and obviously loose rocks have been cleared but little bits are still exfoliating.
